Open position – PhD student 1

The Department of Physical Chemistry at UCT Prague offer a four-year PhD position in XXX in the group of Dr. Vit Svoboda.

Job description

We are looking for a highly motivated person interested in pursuing PhD research on XXX.

The expected start is XXX.

Your profile

You must have:

  • a diploma/MSc degree in physical chemistry or chemical physics
  • fundamental knowledge of XXX
  • experience with programming (XXX)
  • good communication skills
  • fluency in English
  • the willingness to fully commit yourself as part of the team

In addition, you should be interested in XXX.

Your workplace

University of Chemistry and Technology, Prague Technická 5 166 28 Praha 6 – Dejvice Czech Republic

You can find more about life in Prague here. Some information about the university and its history can be accessed here.

We offer

UCT Prague is a natural centre of first-rate study and research in the area of chemistry in Czechia and is one of the country’s largest educational and research institutions focused on technical chemistry, chemical and biochemical technologies, material and chemical engineering, food chemistry, and environmental studies. There is over 800 doctoral students conducting cutting-edge research work in all of its four faculties.

In the lab, you can expect a challenging and scientifically highly exciting full-time position in a dynamic team. Furthermore, we strongly support participation at international conferences. In the project, you will also collaborate with XXX.

We offer a competitive salary commensurate with experience and in accordance with UCT Prague guidelines. The starting salary for this position is in the range of [specific amount] to [specific amount] per year. In addition to the base salary, we provide [mention any additional benefits, such as health insurance, retirement plans, etc.].

You can find more information about PhD studies at UCT Prague here.

Interested?

We are looking forward to receiving your application with the following documents:

  • comprehensive CV (max. 2 pages)
  • a cover letter stating your motivation (max. 1 page)
  • your BSc and MSc transcripts
  • electronic copies of the BSc and MSc theses and your publications (if available)
  • names and contact details of references

Please note that we accept only applications that include all required documents. Uncomplete applications will not be considered.

For further information and to submit your application, please contact Dr. Vit Svoboda via email.
